citeinfo.origin: Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education , Office of Data System Management
citeinfo.title: MO 2012 Public Schools (SHP)
citeinfo.othercit: Original data provided by Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education - http://mcds.dese.mo.gov/guidedinquiry/Pages/District-and-School-Information.aspx.

descript.abstract: Contains locations of all identified Missouri Schools during the 2012-2013 school year.
descript.purpose: Missouri schools. This layer currently includes public schools as provided by the Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education.
descript.supplinf: Locations generated using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS from data provided by Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education from their web site (http://www.dese.mo.gov/directory/download.html) Quality Control by Geographic Resources Center (GRC) completed 10/13/2003 to adjust for false Geocoding results. (Geocoding points that were originally accurate to the ZIP code centroid.) PUBLIC SCHOOLS updated 5/2004. Locational updates provided by GEOGRAPHIC RESOURCE CENTER 6/24/2004 New schools for year 2004-2005 placed using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. 5/9/2007 - schools closed since 2005-2006 were deleted. Schools new for 2006-2007 were added by geocoding addresses with Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Enrollment for these new schools is "0" at the time of data layer creation. 4/7/2008 - new schools for 2007-2008 school year added. Several corrections to locations made to GRC work done in 2003. 3/31/2009 - new schools for 2008-2009 added, any closed schools removed. Locations of new schools photo identified if possible. 2/5/2010 - new schools for 2009-2010 added, any closed schools removed. Location of new schools photo identified if possible. NOTE: Charter schools, which had been previously stored as a separate layer for 2008-09 school year are now included in this public school layers. 10/2010: Data was field verified in the Southeast region of Missouri by staff in the SEMO and Bootheel Regional Planning Commission (RPC) offices, and corrections were added to this file by Missouri State Emergency Management Agency GIS staff. Data that has been field verified by these agencies has a value of "RPC" in the field "LocCode". 11/2011 New Schools were added, closed schools were removed. New schools were photo verified. Comments field added to allow for including information on schools damaged due to Joplin tornado. 09/2013 New Schools were added, closed schools were removed. New schools were photo verified. As several schools have went to a central address, physical addresses were provided for these schools (where different).

idinfo.datacred: Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000

horizpa.horizpar: Matched to Missouri 1 meter Digital Ortho Quarter Quadrangles - 2004

procstep.procdesc: As a quality check, entire table is geocoded again. Fields for X and Y coordinates are added to this temporary file using the ArcMap command Calculate Geometry. Shape file from previous step also has these fields added. In Access, a table is created that contains the ID, school name and XY coordinates pairs for each. This resultant table is used to generate a line file using the Hawth's Tools command Add XY Line Data from Table. Length of these lines are calculated in miles using the ArcMap Calculate Geometry command. Schools that were more than 1 mile different (between original check at MU in 2004 and regeocoded locations) were verified. Several points were determined to be incorrect (often high school and junior high locations were reversed).,UPDATES FOR 2009 -XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2008-2009. New schools are put into a new file for processing.,As a quality check, entire table is geocoded again. Fields for X and Y coordinates are added to this temporary file using the ArcMap command Calculate Geometry. Shape file from previous step also has these fields added. In Access, a table is created that contains the ID, school name and XY coordinates pairs for each. This resultant table is used to generate a line file using the Hawth's Tools command Add XY Line Data from Table. Length of these lines are calculated in miles using the ArcMap Calculate Geometry command. Schools that were more than 1 mile different (between original check at MU in 2004 and regeocoded locations) were verified. Several points were determined to be incorrect (often high school and junior high locations were reversed).,UPDATES FOR 2009 -XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2008-2009. New schools are put into a new file for processing. New facilities for 2009 (there were 29) were geocoded using the software Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on 2008 aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2009-2010 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name.

Table of new addresses was geocoded using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS; personal geodatabase file created. Facilities that had closed since last data update were delete. New addresses geocoded in previous were appended to the file. Locations were checked against 2004 NAIP aerial photography to refine location

Location of several facilities previously located with aerial photography were further refined during a QA/QC process for a layer for all licensed daycares in Missouri. Many of these daycares are afterschool programs located in the school facilities.
Excel data provided by program converted to Access table. School IDs (SCHID) from previous year (2005-2006) was used to determine which facilities were closed and which facilities were newly opened.

As a quality check, entire table is geocoded again. Fields for X and Y coordinates are added to this temporary file using the ArcMap command Calculate Geometry. Shape file from previous step also has these fields added. In Access, a table is created that contains the ID, school name and XY coordinates pairs for each. This resultant table is used to generate a line file using the Hawth's Tools command Add XY Line Data from Table. Length of these lines are calculated in miles using the ArcMap Calculate Geometry command. Schools that were more than 1 mile different (between original check at MU in 2004 and regeocoded locations) were verified. Several points were determined to be incorrect (often high school and junior high locations were reversed).,UPDATES FOR 2009 -XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2008-2009. New schools are put into a new file for processing.,As a quality check, entire table is geocoded again. Fields for X and Y coordinates are added to this temporary file using the ArcMap command Calculate Geometry. Shape file from previous step also has these fields added. In Access, a table is created that contains the ID, school name and XY coordinates pairs for each. This resultant table is used to generate a line file using the Hawth's Tools command Add XY Line Data from Table. Length of these lines are calculated in miles using the ArcMap Calculate Geometry command. Schools that were more than 1 mile different (between original check at MU in 2004 and regeocoded locations) were verified. Several points were determined to be incorrect (often high school and junior high locations were reversed).,UPDATES FOR 2009 -XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2008-2009. New schools are put into a new file for processing. New facilities for 2009 (there were 29) were geocoded using the software Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on 2008 aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2009-2010 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name.

New facilities for 2009 were geocoded using the software Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on 2007 aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2008-2009 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name.

New facilities for 2011 were geocoded using the ArcGIS 10.0 Online Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2011 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name
Schools for Stet and Revere were removed from the data layer. These school districts were closed on June 30, 2012.

New facilities for 2012 were geocoded using the ArcGIS 10.0 Online Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2012 sites. As several schools have began using a single district address for all buildings, the physical address of buildings in these districts were added to the "Address2" attribute.

attr.attrdef: Reports the locational accuracy of the match, includes whether or not an address geocode is achieved.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

edom.edomvd: Location approximated; centrally located in general vicinity i.e. center of town. Positional accuracy will vary - unable to find location on aerial photograph
Location based on address matching provided by Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Location is placed along a particular road segment.
Location based on existing map features that were previously photo identified using 2004 NAIP aerial photography by staff at Geographic Resource Center at MU.
Location based on existing map features that were previously photo identified using aerial photography and Google Street view by OGI staff.
location field verified by local Regional Planning Commission staff

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attr.attrdef: Used to link school locations with school attendance. Created by combining the district number and the school number provided by DESE
attr.attrdefs: Office of Geospatial Information.

attr.attrdef: School District number
attr.attrdefs: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

attr.attrdef: School number (numbers assigned per district and are not unique, see SCHID)
attr.attrdefs: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

attr.attrdef: Additional information about each school.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Geospatial Information.
